body:
I disagree.

The memory security should be provided by programmer if who pass pointer between Go and C, should NOT be provided by Golang runtime.
A Go pointer must be able to operate C memory area, and a C pointer also could be able to operate Go memory, this is the Go runtime ability which must be  provided with enough flexibility and freedom of programming.
Don't check any pointer passing, it's programmer's responsibility.

**Maintaining best performance and enough flexibility is the primary task of Golang, any idea undermining this rule is stupid.**
